jparsec.graph.chartRendering

Class RenderEclipse

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.graph.chartRendering.RenderEclipse

  • public class RenderEclipse
extends java.lang.Object
    Calculates eclipse maps and local circumstances. Based on Elements of solar eclipses 1951-2200, by Jean Meeus. Check also the interesting work by J. García Ferrer (in Spanish) at http://personal.telefonica.terra.es/web/xgarciaf/eclipse/eclipse.htm, used for the implementation done here.

    Bessel elements used in this class are those computed by Shinobu Takesako using JPL DE422 ephemerides. See EmapWin Ver. 2.12 (2012.11.17), downloadable from http://www.kotenmon.com/cal/emapwin_eng.htm. All solar eclipses between year 3000 B.C. and 3000 A.D. are available.

    Note implementation is not completely robust. Charts of solar eclipses are not completely clean, and SolarEclipse and LunarEclipse classes are used to correct the approximate start/end times of the different phases of the eclipses.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain)
    See Also:
    SolarEclipse, LunarEclipse

    • Field Detail

      • ShowWithoutLT

        public static boolean ShowWithoutLT
        True to show information in a simplified way for divulgation, without LT (local time). Default is false.

      • ShowMoonTexture

        public static boolean ShowMoonTexture
        Selects if the Moon texture should be shown or not. Default is false.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RenderEclipse

        public RenderEclipse(AstroDate astro)
              throws JPARSECException
        Basic constructor for a given date. Calculations uses Besselian elements from the data included in JPARSEC.
        Parameters:
        astro - The approximate date (within 1 day) of a given solar eclipse.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If the day is wrong or outside range -3000 to +3000.

    • Method Detail

      • getEclipseDate

        public AstroDate getEclipseDate()
        Returns the date found for the solar eclipse calculated in this instance.
        Returns:
        The eclipse date.

      • isVisible

        public boolean isVisible(ObserverElement obs)
                  throws JPARSECException
        Calculates if any part of the eclipse is visible from a given observer.
        Parameters:
        obs - The observer.
        Returns:
        False if even the partial phase cannot be visible, true if at least the partial phase is visible.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getGreatestMagnitude

        public double getGreatestMagnitude(ObserverElement obs)
                            throws JPARSECException
        Calculates the maximum magnitude of a solar eclipse from a given location.
        Parameters:
        obs - The observer.
        Returns:
        The greatest magnitude. -1 is returned in case the iteration required for this calculation does not converge. In that case the eclipse is anyway not visible.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getCentralEclipse

        public LocationElement getCentralEclipse(AstroDate astroUTC)
                                  throws JPARSECException
        Returns the position and anchor of the Earths shadow for a given instant.
        Parameters:
        astroUTC - The date in UTC.
        Returns:
        The geographical coordinates of the Earth's shadow, and its anchor in km in the radius field. Null is returned when there's no shadow.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • solarEclipseMap

        public void solarEclipseMap(TimeElement.SCALE outputTimeScale,
                   ObserverElement observer,
                   EphemerisElement eph0,
                   Graphics g2,
                   SatelliteRenderElement.PLANET_MAP map)
                     throws JPARSECException
        Creates an image only with the map of a solar eclipse.
        Parameters:
        outputTimeScale - The output time scale to use for labels in the chart.
        observer - The observer. The name will be written at the observer's location unless that name is set to an empty string.
        eph0 - The ephemeris properties.
        g2 - The Graphics object. Anaglyph mode and color properties are used to render the map.
        map - Options for the map.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • solarEclipseMaximum

        public TimeElement solarEclipseMaximum(ObserverElement obs,
                              EphemerisElement eph0)
                                throws JPARSECException
        Returns the maximum of the eclipse.
        Parameters:
        obs - Observer.
        eph0 - Ephemeris properties.
        Returns:
        The maximum.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • renderSolarEclipse

        public void renderSolarEclipse(TimeElement.SCALE outputTimeScale,
                      ObserverElement obs,
                      EphemerisElement eph0,
                      Graphics g,
                      boolean horizontalCoord,
                      SatelliteRenderElement.PLANET_MAP map)
                        throws JPARSECException
        Creates a chart of a solar eclipse with an scheme of the eclipse and optionally also the map.
        Parameters:
        outputTimeScale - The output time scale for the time labels in the chart.
        obs - The observer.
        eph0 - The ephemeris properties.
        g - The Graphics object.
        horizontalCoord - True to show the chart in horizontal coordinates, false for equatorial ones.
        map - Options for the eclipse map. null will render no map at all.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • renderLunarEclipse

        public static void renderLunarEclipse(TimeElement time0,
                      ObserverElement obs,
                      EphemerisElement eph0,
                      Graphics g,
                      boolean horizontalCoord,
                      SatelliteRenderElement.PLANET_MAP map)
                               throws JPARSECException
        Creates a chart with a scheme of a lunar eclipse and optionally also the eclipse map.
        Parameters:
        time0 - The time object with the correct date (just date) of the eclipse. The time scale of this object will be also used for the time labels in the chart.
        obs - The observer.
        eph0 - The ephemeris properties.
        g - The Graphics object.
        horizontalCoord - True to show the chart in horizontal coordinates, false for equatorial ones.
        map - Options for the eclipse map. null will render no map at all.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • lunarEclipseMap

        public static void lunarEclipseMap(TimeElement time,
                   ObserverElement observer,
                   EphemerisElement eph0,
                   Graphics g,
                   SatelliteRenderElement.PLANET_MAP map)
                            throws JPARSECException
        Creates a chart with only the map of a lunar eclipse.
        Parameters:
        time - The time object with the correct date of the lunar eclipse.
        observer - The observer. It will not be shown in case its name is set to an empty string. In that case the strings showing the edge where the eclipse maximum occurs at moonrise/moonset will not be shown.
        eph0 - The ephemeris properties.
        g - The Graphics object. Anaglyph mode property is used to render the map in 3d.
        map - Options for the eclipse map.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • lunarEclipseVisible

        public static boolean lunarEclipseVisible(TimeElement time0,
                          ObserverElement obs,
                          EphemerisElement eph0,
                          boolean considerPenumbralPhase)
                                   throws JPARSECException
        Returns if a given lunar eclipse is visible from a given observer.
        Parameters:
        time0 - The time object with the date of a lunar eclipse.
        obs - The observer.
        eph0 - The ephemerides properties.
        considerPenumbralPhase - True to consider penumbral phase, false to return if the partial eclipse is visible or not.
        Returns:
        True if the eclipse is visible (the entire eclipse, the beginning, or the ending).
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • lunarEclipseMagnitude

        public static double lunarEclipseMagnitude(TimeElement time0,
                           ObserverElement obs,
                           EphemerisElement eph0)
                                    throws JPARSECException
        Returns the magnitude of a lunar eclipse
        Parameters:
        time0 - The time object with the correct date (just date) of the eclipse. The time scale of this object will be also used for the time labels in the chart.
        obs - The observer.
        eph0 - The ephemeris properties.
        Returns:
        The magnitude of the eclipse.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getGoogleMapLink

        public java.lang.String getGoogleMapLink()
        Returns a link to show a Google Map view of this solar eclipse using the maps by Xavier Jubier at http://xjubier.free.fr.
        Returns:
        The URL to the Google Map.

        Parameters:
        args - Not used.
